column4: hi, i get a kernel panic when booting ubuntu. I have about 10 other old kernels, and i get a kernel too when i try to boot with those.. any ideas on how i can fix this?
i can boot with a very old installed kernel
i just upgraded with the package manager .. i didnt see which packages.. the recommended ones
what should i look for in that list? are those the dates of package upgrades?
Package upgrades are same as installed packages.  (You are looking for date/time of upgrade.)
do you have any idea how i can see or log the output of the bootup of my system? i would like to see what the kernel panic is but i can only see the end of the stack and cannot scroll
From that output you should be able to see which packages were upgraded at the particular time you pulled the triger on the update.
the problem is.. it started failing 10 upgrades ago.. i upgrade regularly to see if the new upgrade fixes the problem.. it usually doesnt, and i kept booting with an old kernel.
You might try looking for the latest kernel in that list, (ls -ltr shows latest last), and re-install that kenrnel.
Or uninstall and re-install, (maybe even using purge).
Or just any of the latest ones that have recently been installed.
It sounds like it is a kernel module that is being loaded into the running kernel.  If you watch closely as it boots a broken one, you may be able to see it.
